= Introduction =
This document adheres to IEEE Std. 830-1998.

== Purpose ==
The document describes the requirements for the Open Decision Repository (hereinafter ODR). The ODR is a project of the Software Engineering and Architecture Group (SEARCH) at the University of Groningen (RUG). The originator is Mr. Uwe van Heesch. He is currently writing a paper about documentation and visualization of architectural decisions together with Paris Avgeriou and Rich Hilliard. This project serves as a prototyp which may also be used to defend the paper.

Everybody who is interested in the intended functionality of the ODR may read this paper. This includes prospective developers and users.

== Scope ==
The Open Decision Repository will provide functionality to document and visualize decisions that have been made in a project. It's a freely available repository to store all decisions within a project. It provides the functionallity to share the entire project with other members, who can get a insight into the decisions and the rationale behind them.
You can also get three different kinds of views. 
 * a chronical view about the decisons and the members who take these
 * a stakeholder involvement view, that describes the actions of every role
 * and a relationship view, that describe the dependencies of decisions.
Another very important point is the revision control, which enables switching between differet versions of decisions.

There are four main parts in the project:
 * project management (e.g. create a project)
 * user management (e.g. create user with different roles)
 * decision visualization (e.g. get a chronical visualization)
 * administration (administrate the ODR)

== User characteristics ==
This project will be used by three different kinds of users.

 * Guest
The guest uses the system only to get a look into projects, which are pushlished. He can browse through the projects or find projects by using the search function. 

 * User
The normal visitor of the system is a registrated user. He can create projects, can add  members and manage the entire project. Project members have to take a role within a project like "Software-architect", "manager" or "customer". Every role has different functionallity in the system that is adapeted to its scope of dutys. Furthermore he is able to get a look in all views (chronical view, stakeholder view and relationship view) of his projects and other published projects.

 * Administrator
The administrator is able to manage the entities in the system. He can add common  entities or delete unesed entities. 


== Constraints ==
The project is a non budget project, therefore all technologies that will be used for the realization must be open source or at least free of charge. Preferably, these technologies should be licensed under GPL v2.

<LI>Menu to select a template _(required)_</LI>
<LI>Date field with date picker _(required)_</LI>
<li>Menu to select requirements, which are drivers for this decision</li>

</ul>
</li>

<ul>

</ul>

</ul>
</li>

<li> Overview
<ul>
<li>A confirmation page that shows all previously entered data</li>
</ul>
</li>

</ol></li>

<LI>The user confirmes his entries with _submit_</LI>
<LI>The system saves this new decision and the current date</LI>
</OL>

= Non-functional requirements =

This section describes the non-functional requirements. Each of these non-functional requirements (NFR) has an id, as well as an assigned characteristic. These characteristics are the ones that are specified in _ISO/IEC 9126-1:2001_.


<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" width="650">
<thead>
  <tr>
    <th width="30">ID</th>
    <td width="50">NFR-1</td>
    <th width="80">Characteristic</th>
    <td>Functionality</td>
  </tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
  <tr>
    <td colspan="4">
The ODR should provide a web interface. This web interface should at least support the following web browsers and newer versions of these browsers
<ul>
<li>Microsoft Internet Explorer version 7</li>
<li>Mozilla Firefox version 3.5</li>
<li>Google Chrome version 5</li>
<li>Apple Safari version 5</li>
<li>Opera version 10</li>
</ul>
</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table>


<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" width="650">
<thead>
  <tr>
    <th width="30">ID</th>
    <td width="50">NFR-2</td>
    <th width="80">Characteristic</th>
    <td>Reliability</td>
  </tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
  <tr>
    <td colspan="4">
Stored data must never get lost neither become inconsistent at any time.
</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" width="650">
<thead>
  <tr>
    <th width="30">ID</th>
    <td width="50">NFR-3</td>
    <th width="80">Characteristic</th>
    <td>Usability</td>
  </tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
  <tr>
    <td colspan="4">
The web interface should not require any special expertise in the area of web applications. In addition it should support the user by providing [http://ui-patterns.com/patterns/GoodDefaults good defaults].
</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table>

<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" width="650">
<thead>
  <tr>
    <th width="30">ID</th>
    <td width="50">NFR-4</td>
    <th width="80">Characteristic</th>
    <td>Usability</td>
  </tr>
</thead>
<tbody>
  <tr>
    <td colspan="4">

</td>
  </tr>
</tbody>
</table>
